On Sep 2, 2004, at 9:07 AM, Bill Oliver wrote:

> Hi,
>
> I'm using Junit as a test harness for some non-Java tests. To be
> precise, Junit drives a file comparison operation and if the output
> file is different from the benchmark file, an error is produced.
>
> All of this works fine, but I would like to over-ride the output that
> appears in the TYPE column of the report. Specifically I would like
> to hide the traceback and add my own custom text. Ideally, this
> custom text would include a hyperlink.
>
> Any thoughts? The output I get now follows...

The XSL template used to generate those reports is in

     $ANT_HOME/etc/junit-frames.xsl

You can customize it any way you like.

Mike
